doc.field: Subseries III.A. Executive Director Eva Auchincloss records
Subseries III.A. Executive Director Eva Auchincloss records

Subseries III.A contains records of Eva Auchincloss, the first Executive Director of the WSF, who served as Executive Director from 1976-1986. Records include documents describing WSF history, research files, correspondence, Board meeting minutes and reports, publications, and subject files. Records date from 1983-1986.

Eva Auchincloss was the founding Executive Director of the WSF and was responsible for implementing most of the fundraising and educational programs of the Foundation. Before her appointment as Executive Director in January 1976, she served as the Associate Publisher of womenSports magazine from 1974. Upon appointment, Auchincloss recruited the Advisory Board of the WSF, composed of athlete representatives and representatives from a variety of sports-related fields. Achievements during her tenure included: establishing the New York Awards Dinner as a fundraising event and showcase, spearheading and planning The New Agenda conference held in 1983, and implementing educational programs, particularly the toll-free information and referral line, publication of camp scholarship and athletic scholarship guides, and the High School All-Star awards program. Her term as Executive Director ended in 1986.
